smashy 0.0.0-9000
  • Reference

Stratify Training by Feature

Source: R/PipeOpStratify.R
mlr_pipeops_stratify.Rd

Subset the input as a Multiplicity, causing subsequent PipeOps to be executed independently for each stratum according to stratify_feature.

# TODO: missing: 'build only the model with the highest stratify param value'

Format

R6Class object inheriting from PipeOp.

Construction

PipeOpStratify$new(id = "stratify", param_vals = list())

  • id :: character(1) Identifier of the resulting object, default "stratify".

  • param_vals :: named list
    List of hyperparameter settings, overwriting the hyperparameter settings that would otherwise be set during construction. Default list().

Input and Output Channels

PipeOpStratify has one input channel named "input", taking a Task, both during training and prediction.

PipeOpStratify has two output channels; one named "output", returning Task subsets as a Multiplicity during training and prediction; and one named "fallback", containing the whole Task during training and the subset of the input Task that doesn't fit any stratum during prediction.

State

The $state is a named list with the following entries:

  • stratify_values :: any
    Vector indicating the values of features by which

Parameters

  • stratify_feature :: character(1)
    Name of the feature to stratify by.

  • min_size :: integer(1)
    Minimum number of samples for a stratification level so that a model gets trained. Initializedto 1.

  • predict_choice :: character(1)
    How to choose the model with which to make predictions. "exact": only model with exactly matching stratification value used. "exact_or_greater": if exact model was not trained, take the model with next higher stratify value. "exact_or_less": if exact model was not trained, take the model with the next lower stratify value. "nearest": Take the model with nearest stratify value, whether lower or higher. Initialized to "exact".
    Whenever a model with exact / greater / smaller / any stratify value is not present, the "fallback" model is used.

Fields

Only fields inherited from PipeOp.

Methods

Only methods inherited from PipeOp.

See also

https://mlr3book.mlr-org.com/list-pipeops.html
